intro: Meibomia pubens, commonly known as the rough meibomia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa and Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and hairy stems, which give it its common name. Its leaves are typically opposite and have a rough texture. Meibomia pubens is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
